1â†’# NixOS Hydenix Configuration
     2â†’
     3â†’A modern, modular NixOS configuration using Hydenix, Hyprland, and flakes with automatic hardware detection and GitHub synchronization.
     4â†’
     5â†’## ğŸš€ Features
     6â†’
     7â†’- **Hydenix Desktop Environment** - Pre-configured Hyprland-based desktop with modern aesthetics

     9â†’- **Auto-commit to GitHub** - Automatically commits and pushes configuration changes on rebuild
    10â†’- **Flake-based Configuration** - Reproducible, version-pinned system configuration
    11â†’- **Home Manager Integration** - Declarative user environment management
    12â†’- **Modular Structure** - Clean separation of system and user configurations
    13â†’

    33â†’
    34â†’âš ï¸ **Important**: Always rebuild with the `--impure` flag to ensure hardware detection works:
    35â†’
    36â†’```bash
    37â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

    54â†’3. **Build and Switch**
    55â†’   ```bash

    59â†’## ğŸ“ Project Structure
    60â†’
    61â†’```
    62â†’/nix-modules/
    63â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                 # Flake configuration entrypoint
    64â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.lock               # Version lock file
    65â†’â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix        # Main system configuration

    74â†’
    75â†’## ğŸ”§ Configuration

    77â†’### System Configuration

    80â†’
    81â†’Key settings to customize:

    97â†’
    98â†’## ğŸ¯ Key Features Explained
    99â†’
   100â†’### Automatic Hardware Detection
   101â†’
   102â†’The configuration includes a smart hardware detection system that:
   103â†’- Uses `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` when available
   104â†’- Falls back to a placeholder for repository storage

   106â†’- Requires `--impure` flag for nixos-rebuild
   107â†’
   108â†’### Auto-commit to GitHub

   121â†’### Hydenix Integration
   122â†’
   123â†’Hydenix provides:
   124â†’- Pre-configured Hyprland window manager
   125â†’- Modern UI/UX with animations
   126â†’- Integrated application launcher
   127â†’- Workspace management
   128â†’- Screen recording/screenshot tools
   129â†’
   130â†’## ğŸ”„ Daily Usage
   131â†’
   132â†’### Rebuilding the System
   133â†’
   134â†’Always use the impure flag for hardware detection:
   135â†’```bash
   136â†’cd /nix-modules
   137â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   138â†’```
   139â†’
   140â†’### Updating from GitHub
   141â†’
   142â†’```bash
   143â†’cd /nix-modules
   144â†’sudo git pull origin main
   145â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   146â†’```
   147â†’
   148â†’### Manual Commit and Push
   149â†’
   150â†’If auto-commit is disabled or fails:
   151â†’```bash
   152â†’cd /nix-modules
   153â†’sudo git add -A
   154â†’sudo git commit -m "Your commit message"
   155â†’sudo git push origin main
   156â†’```
   157â†’
   158â†’## ğŸ› Troubleshooting
   159â†’
   160â†’### Hardware Configuration Issues
   161â†’
   162â†’If system won't boot after pulling from GitHub:
   163â†’1. Boot from previous generation (select in GRUB)
   164â†’2. Copy your hardware config:
   165â†’   ```bash
   166â†’   sudo cp /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix /nix-modules/
   167â†’   ```
   168â†’3. Rebuild with `--impure` flag
   169â†’
   170â†’### GitHub Authentication
   171â†’
   172â†’If auto-push fails:
   173â†’```bash
   174â†’gh auth login
   175â†’# Follow the prompts to authenticate
   176â†’```
   177â†’
   178â†’### Dirty Git Tree Warnings
   179â†’
   180â†’This is normal when you have uncommitted changes. The auto-commit module will handle this, or commit manually.
   181â†’
   182â†’### Permission Errors
   183â†’
   184â†’Most operations require sudo as `/nix-modules` is system-wide:
   185â†’```bash
   186â†’sudo git add -A
   187â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   188â†’```
   189â†’
   190â†’## ğŸš¦ Best Practices
   191â†’
   192â†’1. **Always use `--impure` flag** when rebuilding
   193â†’2. **Test changes locally** before pushing to GitHub
   194â†’3. **Keep secrets out of configuration** - they'll be world-readable in Nix store
   195â†’4. **Regular commits** - Let auto-commit handle routine changes
   196â†’5. **Document custom modules** - Add comments for future reference
   197â†’6. **Version control discipline** - Review changes before rebuilding
   198â†’
   199â†’## ğŸ“š Additional Resources
   200â†’
   201â†’- [NixOS Manual](https://nixos.org/manual/nixos/stable/)
   202â†’- [Home Manager Documentation](https://nix-community.github.io/home-manager/)
   203â†’- [Hyprland Wiki](https://wiki.hyprland.org/)
   204â†’- [Nix Flakes Guide](https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Flakes)
   205â†’- [Hydenix Documentation](https://github.com/hydenix/hydenix)
   206â†’
   207â†’## ğŸ¤ Contributing
   208â†’
   209â†’1. Fork the repository
   210â†’2. Create a feature branch
   211â†’3. Make your changes
   212â†’4. Test thoroughly with `nixos-rebuild build`
   213â†’5. Submit a pull request
   214â†’
   215â†’## ğŸ“„ License
   216â†’
   217â†’This configuration is provided as-is for personal use and learning purposes.
   218â†’
   219â†’## âš ï¸ Security Notes
   220â†’
   221â†’- Change default passwords immediately after installation
   222â†’- Don't commit secrets or sensitive data
   223â†’- Review all configuration changes before applying
   224â†’- Keep your system updated regularly
   225â†’
   226â†’## ğŸ’¡ Tips
   227â†’
   228â†’- Use `nixos-rebuild build` to test without switching
   229â†’- Check generation differences with `nixos-rebuild --rollback`
   230â†’- View system logs with `journalctl -xe`

file.content:
# NixOS Hydenix Configuration

A modern, modular NixOS configuration using Hydenix, Hyprland, and flakes with automatic hardware detection and GitHub synchronization.

## ğŸš€ Features

- **Hydenix Desktop Environment** - Pre-configured Hyprland-based desktop with modern aesthetics
- **Automatic Hardware Detection** - Smart hardware configuration management that survives repository syncs
- **Auto-commit to GitHub** - Automatically commits and pushes configuration changes on rebuild
- **Flake-based Configuration** - Reproducible, version-pinned system configuration
- **Home Manager Integration** - Declarative user environment management
- **Modular Structure** - Clean separation of system and user configurations

## ğŸ“‹ Prerequisites

- NixOS 24.11 or later
- Git installed and configured
- GitHub account (for auto-sync features)
- Basic understanding of NixOS and flakes

## ğŸ› ï¸ Installation

### 1. Clone the Repository

```bash
sudo git clone https://github.com/0x64616e61/nix-modules.git /nix-modules
cd /nix-modules
```

### 2. Hardware Configuration

The system automatically detects and uses your local hardware configuration. No manual copying required!

âš ï¸ **Important**: Always rebuild with the `--impure` flag to ensure hardware detection works:

```bash
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### 3. Initial Setup

1. **Update User Configuration**
   - Edit `configuration.nix`
   - Change username from "a" to your desired username (lines 75 and 87)
   - Update initial password (line 89)
   - Set your hostname (line 103)
   - Configure timezone and locale (lines 104-105)

2. **Configure GitHub Authentication** (for auto-sync)
   ```bash
   gh auth login
   ```

3. **Build and Switch**
   ```bash
   sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   ```

## ğŸ“ Project Structure

```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                 # Flake configuration entrypoint
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.lock               # Version lock file
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix        # Main system configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix      # Hardware detection wrapper
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-configuration.nix  # Placeholder (auto-replaced)
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ system/             # System-level modules
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ auto-commit.nix # GitHub auto-sync module
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ hm/                 # Home Manager modules
â””â”€â”€ docs/                   # Documentation
```

## ğŸ”§ Configuration

### System Configuration

Main configuration file: `configuration.nix`

Key settings to customize:
- **Username**: Update in both `home-manager.users` and `users.users`
- **Hostname**: Set in `hydenix.hostname`
- **Timezone**: Set in `hydenix.timezone` (e.g., "America/New_York")
- **Locale**: Set in `hydenix.locale` (e.g., "en_US.UTF-8")
- **Hardware modules**: Uncomment relevant lines for GPU, CPU, laptop features

### Home Manager Configuration

User-specific configurations in `modules/hm/`

Manages:
- Desktop environment settings
- Application configurations
- User packages
- Dotfiles

## ğŸ¯ Key Features Explained

### Automatic Hardware Detection

The configuration includes a smart hardware detection system that:
- Uses `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` when available
- Falls back to a placeholder for repository storage
- Survives git pulls without breaking your system
- Requires `--impure` flag for nixos-rebuild

### Auto-commit to GitHub

On every rebuild, the system:
1. Checks for uncommitted changes
2. Automatically commits with timestamp
3. Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
4. Handles authentication gracefully

To disable auto-commit, remove this line from `configuration.nix`:
```nix
./modules/system/auto-commit.nix
```

### Hydenix Integration

Hydenix provides:
- Pre-configured Hyprland window manager
- Modern UI/UX with animations
- Integrated application launcher
- Workspace management
- Screen recording/screenshot tools

## ğŸ”„ Daily Usage

### Rebuilding the System

Always use the impure flag for hardware detection:
```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### Updating from GitHub

```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo git pull origin main
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### Manual Commit and Push

If auto-commit is disabled or fails:
```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo git add -A
sudo git commit -m "Your commit message"
sudo git push origin main
```

## ğŸ› Troubleshooting

### Hardware Configuration Issues

If system won't boot after pulling from GitHub:
1. Boot from previous generation (select in GRUB)
2. Copy your hardware config:
   ```bash
   sudo cp /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix /nix-modules/
   ```
3. Rebuild with `--impure` flag

### GitHub Authentication

If auto-push fails:
```bash
gh auth login
# Follow the prompts to authenticate
```

### Dirty Git Tree Warnings

This is normal when you have uncommitted changes. The auto-commit module will handle this, or commit manually.

### Permission Errors

Most operations require sudo as `/nix-modules` is system-wide:
```bash
sudo git add -A
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

## ğŸš¦ Best Practices

1. **Always use `--impure` flag** when rebuilding
2. **Test changes locally** before pushing to GitHub
3. **Keep secrets out of configuration** - they'll be world-readable in Nix store
4. **Regular commits** - Let auto-commit handle routine changes
5. **Document custom modules** - Add comments for future reference
6. **Version control discipline** - Review changes before rebuilding

## ğŸ“š Additional Resources

- [NixOS Manual](https://nixos.org/manual/nixos/stable/)
- [Home Manager Documentation](https://nix-community.github.io/home-manager/)
- [Hyprland Wiki](https://wiki.hyprland.org/)
- [Nix Flakes Guide](https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Flakes)
- [Hydenix Documentation](https://github.com/hydenix/hydenix)

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch
3. Make your changes
4. Test thoroughly with `nixos-rebuild build`
5. Submit a pull request

## ğŸ“„ License

This configuration is provided as-is for personal use and learning purposes.

## âš ï¸ Security Notes

- Change default passwords immediately after installation
- Don't commit secrets or sensitive data
- Review all configuration changes before applying
- Keep your system updated regularly

## ğŸ’¡ Tips

- Use `nixos-rebuild build` to test without switching
- Check generation differences with `nixos-rebuild --rollback`
- View system logs with `journalctl -xe`
- List generations with `sudo nix-env --list-generations -p /nix/var/nix/profiles/system`

---

*Last updated: September 2025*
*Powered by NixOS, Hydenix, and Hyprland*

1â†’{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:
     2â†’
     3â†’{
     4â†’  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
     5â†’  environment.shellAliases = {
     6â†’    "update!" = ''
     7â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
     8â†’      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
     9â†’      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
    10â†’        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
    11â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
    12â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
    13â†’        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
    14â†’        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
    15â†’      fi && \
    16â†’      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
    17â†’      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    18â†’    '';
    19â†’    
    20â†’    "worksummary" = ''
    21â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
    22â†’      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    23â†’    '';
    24â†’  };
    25â†’
    26â†’  # Add panic function directly to shell init
    27â†’  programs.zsh.enable = true;
    28â†’  programs.bash.enable = true;
    29â†’  
    30â†’  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    31â†’    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    32â†’    panic() {

{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
  environment.shellAliases = {
    "update!" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
      fi && \
      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    '';
    
    "worksummary" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    '';
  };

  # Add panic function directly to shell init
  programs.zsh.enable = true;
  programs.bash.enable = true;
  
  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    panic() {
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[!] PANIC MODE - Rolling back to GitHub..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git fetch origin && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git reset --hard origin/main && \
      echo "[*] Reset complete - local changes discarded"
    }
    
    # Create aliases for various A! patterns
    for i in {1..20}; do
      A=$(printf 'A%.0s' $(seq 1 $i))
      alias "$A!"="panic"
    done
  '';
}

input.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` - primary nixosConfiguration, with `mini` alias matching hostname
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-122` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-99` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:47-49` - nixosConfigurations (hydenix and mini alias)

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` - the only nixosConfiguration defined in flake.nix
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # User-level rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-fix.nix  # Waybar startup fix
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

  echo 'home.packages line:'

  echo 'hardware detection logic:'

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` - the only nixosConfiguration defined in flake.nix
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` - the only nixosConfiguration defined in flake.nix
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # User-level rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-fix.nix  # Waybar startup fix
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

lines: -- **Flake System**: `hydenix` - the only nixosConfiguration defined in flake.nix
+- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # User-level rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-fix.nix  # Waybar startup fix
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper

# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```

file.content:
# Auto-commit and push changes to GitHub on rebuild
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Create a PRE-activation script that runs BEFORE rebuild to fix dirty git tree
  system.activationScripts.autoCommitChanges = lib.mkBefore ''
    echo "Checking for uncommitted changes in /nix-modules..."
    
    # Change to the nix-modules directory
    cd /nix-modules
    
    # Check if there are any changes
    if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
      echo "Found uncommitted changes, committing to fix dirty git tree..."
      
      # Configure git if needed
      git config user.email "noreply@github.com" 2>/dev/null || true
      git config user.name "NixOS Auto-Commit" 2>/dev/null || true
      
      # Add all changes
      git add -A
      
      # Create commit message with timestamp
      TIMESTAMP=$(date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
      git commit -m "Auto-commit: NixOS rebuild at $TIMESTAMP" || {
        echo "Failed to commit changes"
      }
      
      # Try to push using gh CLI from nixpkgs
      echo "Pushing changes to GitHub..."
      if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
        gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      elif [ -f "${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh" ]; then
        ${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      else
        echo "gh CLI not available, skipping push"
      fi
      
      echo "Git tree is now clean"
    else
      echo "No uncommitted changes found"
    fi
  '';
  
  # Ensure gh CLI is installed
  environment.systemPackages = with pkgs; [
    gh
    git
  ];
}

1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.
     8â†’
     9â†’## Critical Context
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
    12â†’- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
    13â†’- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
    14â†’- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Key Commands
    17â†’
    18â†’### Quick System Management
    19â†’```bash

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

1â†’{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:
     2â†’
     3â†’{
     4â†’  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
     5â†’  environment.shellAliases = {
     6â†’    "update!" = ''
     7â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
     8â†’      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
     9â†’      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
    10â†’        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
    11â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
    12â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
    13â†’        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
    14â†’        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
    15â†’      fi && \
    16â†’      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
    17â†’      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    18â†’    '';
    19â†’    
    20â†’    "worksummary" = ''
    21â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
    22â†’      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    23â†’    '';
    24â†’  };
    25â†’
    26â†’  # Add panic function directly to shell init
    27â†’  programs.zsh.enable = true;
    28â†’  programs.bash.enable = true;
    29â†’  
    30â†’  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    31â†’    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    32â†’    panic() {
    33â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
    34â†’      echo "[!] PANIC MODE - Rolling back to GitHub..." && \
    35â†’      echo 7 | sudo -S git fetch origin && \
    36â†’      echo 7 | sudo -S git reset --hard origin/main && \
    37â†’      echo "[*] Reset complete - local changes discarded"
    38â†’    }
    39â†’    
    40â†’    # Create aliases for various A! patterns
    41â†’    for i in {1..20}; do
    42â†’      A=$(printf 'A%.0s' $(seq 1 $i))
    43â†’      alias "$A!"="panic"
    44â†’    done
    45â†’  '';
    46â†’}
    47â†’

file.content:
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
  environment.shellAliases = {
    "update!" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
      fi && \
      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    '';
    
    "worksummary" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    '';
  };

  # Add panic function directly to shell init
  programs.zsh.enable = true;
  programs.bash.enable = true;
  
  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    panic() {
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[!] PANIC MODE - Rolling back to GitHub..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git fetch origin && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git reset --hard origin/main && \
      echo "[*] Reset complete - local changes discarded"
    }
    
    # Create aliases for various A! patterns
    for i in {1..20}; do
      A=$(printf 'A%.0s' $(seq 1 $i))
      alias "$A!"="panic"
    done
  '';
}

content.content:
1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.
     8â†’
     9â†’## Critical Context
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
    12â†’- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
    13â†’- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
    14â†’- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Key Commands
    17â†’
    18â†’### Quick System Management
    19â†’```bash
    20â†’# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
    21â†’update!
    22â†’
    23â†’# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
    24â†’worksummary
    25â†’
    26â†’# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
    27â†’panic
    28â†’# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)
    29â†’
    30â†’# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
    31â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    32â†’
    33â†’# Test configuration without switching
    34â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
    35â†’
    36â†’# Build only (no activation)
    37â†’sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure
    38â†’
    39â†’# Rollback to previous generation
    40â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
    41â†’```
    42â†’
    43â†’### Flake Management
    44â†’```bash
    45â†’# Update all flake inputs
    46â†’nix flake update
    47â†’
    48â†’# Update specific input
    49â†’nix flake update hydenix
    50â†’
    51â†’# Check flake metadata and outputs
    52â†’nix flake show
    53â†’nix flake metadata
    54â†’nix flake check
    55â†’
    56â†’# View system generation differences
    57â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
    58â†’```
    59â†’
    60â†’### Debugging Commands
    61â†’```bash
    62â†’# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
    63â†’sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18
    64â†’
    65â†’# Hyprland diagnostics
    66â†’hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
    67â†’hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
    68â†’hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)
    69â†’
    70â†’# Service and error checking
    71â†’journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
    72â†’journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
    73â†’systemctl --user status    # User services status
    74â†’
    75â†’# Manual service starts (if needed)
    76â†’waybar &                   # Start waybar manually
    77â†’
    78â†’# Check Nix evaluation errors
    79â†’nix flake check --show-trace
    80â†’nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
    81â†’```
    82â†’
    83â†’## Architecture
    84â†’
    85â†’### Configuration Hierarchy
    86â†’```
    87â†’/nix-modules/
    88â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
    89â†’â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
    90â†’â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
    91â†’â””â”€â”€ modules/
    92â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    93â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    94â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    95â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    96â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    97â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    98â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    99â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
   100â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
   101â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
   102â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
   103â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
   104â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
   105â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
   106â†’    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
   107â†’    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
   108â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
   109â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
   110â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
   111â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
   112â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
   113â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
   114â†’        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
