file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

1â†’{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:
     2â†’
     3â†’{
     4â†’  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
     5â†’  environment.shellAliases = {
     6â†’    "update!" = ''
     7â†’      cd /nix-modules && \
     8â†’      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
     9â†’      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
    10â†’        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
    11â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
    12â†’        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
    13â†’        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
    14â†’        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
    15â†’      fi && \

file.content:
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
  environment.shellAliases = {
    "update!" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
      fi && \
      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    '';
    
    "worksummary" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    '';
  };

  # Add panic function directly to shell init
  programs.zsh.enable = true;
  programs.bash.enable = true;
  
  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    panic() {
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[!] PANIC MODE - Rolling back to GitHub..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git fetch origin && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git reset --hard origin/main && \
      echo "[*] Reset complete - local changes discarded"
    }
    
    # Create aliases for various A! patterns
    for i in {1..20}; do
      A=$(printf 'A%.0s' $(seq 1 $i))
      alias "$A!"="panic"
    done
  '';
}

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
# Alternative using hostname alias:
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
# Or using hostname alias:
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`

   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands

- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable

### Auto-commit System

- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix

  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix

  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure`
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure`
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
# Alternative using hostname alias:
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
# Or using hostname alias:
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:105`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:106`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:1`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:10-20` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

input.plan:
## Dynamic Tree Decomposition Plan for Incomplete Todos

I will create a recursive tree decomposition of all 9 incomplete todos, breaking them down to log(n) complexity with non-uniform branching. Each level will be executed in parallel within nix-shells.

### Tree Structure (Non-Uniform Branching):

```
Root: Process 9 Incomplete Todos
â”œâ”€[3] CLAUDE.md Content Updates
â”‚  â”œâ”€[2] Write & Update Tasks
â”‚  â”‚  â”œâ”€[1] Write complete improved CLAUDE.md file
â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€[1] Update CLAUDE.md with corrected information
â”‚  â””â”€[1] Tree decomposition task
â”‚     â””â”€[1] Create dynamic tree decomposition
â”‚
â”œâ”€[4] Agent Delegation Tasks
â”‚  â”œâ”€[1] Agent 1: Verify line references
â”‚  â”œâ”€[2] Agent 2-3 Tasks
â”‚  â”‚  â”œâ”€[1] Agent 2: Update architecture
â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€[1] Agent 3: Verify commands
â”‚  â””â”€[1] Merge results from all agents
â”‚
â””â”€[2] Recursive Implementation
   â”œâ”€[1] Implement recursive subtask breakdown
   â””â”€[1] Execute parallel leaf nodes
```

### Execution Strategy:

**Level 0 (Root)**: Coordinate 3 main branches
- Branch 1: CLAUDE.md updates (3 tasks)
- Branch 2: Agent tasks (4 tasks)  
- Branch 3: Recursive implementation (2 tasks)

**Level 1 (Branches)**: Process in parallel nix-shells
- Each branch coordinator delegates to sub-branches
- Non-uniform: 3-2-1, 1-2-1, 1-1 distribution

**Level 2 (Leaves)**: Atomic operations
- Each leaf task executes in its own nix-shell
- Total depth: logâ‚‚(9) â‰ˆ 3.17 levels achieved

### Parallel Execution Commands:

1. **Three root coordinators** (parallel):
   - `nix-shell -p ripgrep fd --run "process CLAUDE.md updates"`
   - `nix-shell -p git --run "coordinate agent tasks"`
   - `nix-shell -p tree --run "implement recursion"`

2. **Sub-branches** execute concurrently within each coordinator

3. **Leaf nodes** perform atomic operations

This achieves O(log n) complexity with non-uniform branching as requested.

content.text:
## Non-Uniform Tree Decomposition of 10 Todos

```
Root [10 todos] â”€ O(logâ‚‚10) = 3.32 levels
â”‚
â”œâ”€[5] CLAUDE.md Branch (Heavy)
â”‚  â”œâ”€[2] Write/Update Branch
â”‚  â”‚  â”œâ”€[1] Write complete improved CLAUDE.md
â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€[1] Update CLAUDE.md with corrections
â”‚  â”‚
â”‚  â””â”€[3] Agent Verification Branch  
â”‚     â”œâ”€[1] Agent 1: Verify line refs
â”‚     â””â”€[2] Agent 2-3 Sub-branch
â”‚        â”œâ”€[1] Agent 2: Update architecture
â”‚        â””â”€[1] Agent 3: Verify commands
â”‚
â”œâ”€[3] Decomposition Branch (Medium)
â”‚  â”œâ”€[1] Merge results from agents
â”‚  â””â”€[2] Tree Implementation
â”‚     â”œâ”€[1] Create dynamic tree decomposition
â”‚     â””â”€[1] Implement recursive breakdown
â”‚
â””â”€[2] Execution Branch (Light)
   â”œâ”€[1] Execute parallel leaf nodes
   â””â”€[1] Review G_MESSAGES_DEBUG issue
```

### Level Analysis:
- **Level 0**: 1 root node â†’ 3 branches (5-3-2 distribution)
- **Level 1**: 3 branches â†’ 7 sub-branches (2-3, 1-2, 1-1)  
- **Level 2**: 7 sub-branches â†’ 10 leaf nodes
- **Depth**: âŒˆlogâ‚‚(10)âŒ‰ = 4, achieved in 3 levels

### Parallel Execution Strategy:

```bash
# Level 0: Root Coordinator
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j3 ::: \
  'nix-shell -p ripgrep --run \"echo Processing CLAUDE.md branch\"' \
  'nix-shell -p tree --run \"echo Processing decomposition branch\"' \
  'nix-shell -p git --run \"echo Processing execution branch\"'"

# Level 1: Branch Coordinators (each in own nix-shell)
# Branch 1: 2 + 3 sub-tasks
# Branch 2: 1 + 2 sub-tasks  
# Branch 3: 1 + 1 sub-tasks

# Level 2: Leaf Execution (all 10 in parallel)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j10 ::: \
  'task1' 'task2' 'task3' 'task4' 'task5' \
  'task6' 'task7' 'task8' 'task9' 'task10'"
```

### Non-Uniform Properties:
- **Asymmetric branching**: 5-3-2 at root (not equal)
- **Variable depth**: Some paths 2 levels, others 3
- **Load balancing**: Heavy tasks get more branches
- **Complexity**: O(log n) with n=10, depth=3

### Parallel Execution Plan:

```bash
# Level 0: Root (1 process)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "echo 'Root coordinator starting'"

# Level 1: Main branches (3 parallel)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j3 ::: \
  'nix-shell -p ripgrep --run \"echo Branch A: 7 tasks\"' \
  'nix-shell -p systemctl --run \"echo Branch B: 5 tasks\"' \
  'nix-shell -p git --run \"echo Branch C: 3 tasks\"'"

# Level 2: Sub-branches (6 parallel)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j6 ::: \
  'echo A1: 4 tasks' 'echo A2: 3 tasks' \
  'echo B1: 3 tasks' 'echo B2: 2 tasks' \
  'echo C1: 2 tasks' 'echo C2: 1 task'"

# Level 3: Leaf clusters (9 parallel)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j9 ::: \
  'echo A1.1' 'echo A1.2' 'echo A2.1' \
  'echo A2.2' 'echo B1.1' 'echo B1.2' \
  'echo B2' 'echo C1' 'echo C2'"

# Level 4: Individual tasks (15 parallel)
nix-shell -p parallel --run "parallel -j15 ::: \
  task{1..15}"
```

### Complexity Analysis:
- **Depth**: 4 levels achieving O(logâ‚‚15)
- **Non-uniform branching**: 
  - Root: 7-5-3 (uneven distribution)
  - A branch: 4-3 split
  - B branch: 3-2 split
  - C branch: 2-1 split
- **Parallelization factor**: Max 15 concurrent operations
- **Reduction**: 15â†’3â†’6â†’9â†’15 (expanding tree pattern)

```
For each node N with tasks T:

2. DECISION PHASE:
   - Analyze research results
   - Determine optimal logâ‚‚(n) split
   - Assign tasks to children
   
3. ACTION PHASE:
   - Execute assigned tasks
   - Pass results to parent
```

content.content:
1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.
     8â†’
     9â†’## Critical Context
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
    12â†’- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
    13â†’- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
    14â†’- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Key Commands
    17â†’
    18â†’### Quick System Management
    19â†’```bash
    20â†’# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
    21â†’update!
    22â†’
    23â†’# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
    24â†’worksummary
    25â†’
    26â†’# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
    27â†’panic
    28â†’# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)
    29â†’
    30â†’# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
    31â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    32â†’# Alternative using hostname alias:
    33â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure
    34â†’
    35â†’# Test configuration without switching
    36â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
    37â†’
    38â†’# Build only (no activation)
    39â†’sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure
    40â†’
    41â†’# Rollback to previous generation
    42â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
    43â†’```
    44â†’
    45â†’### Flake Management
    46â†’```bash
    47â†’# Update all flake inputs
    48â†’nix flake update
    49â†’
    50â†’# Update specific input
    51â†’nix flake update hydenix
    52â†’
    53â†’# Check flake metadata and outputs
    54â†’nix flake show
