# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
# Alternative using hostname alias:
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
# Or using hostname alias:
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:47-48` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

1â†’# Hardware configuration wrapper
     2â†’# This module handles hardware configuration for both local and flake builds
     3â†’{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:
     4â†’
     5â†’let
     6â†’  # Check if we have access to /etc/nixos (impure mode)
     7â†’  hasSystemConfig = builtins.pathExists /etc/nixos;
     8â†’  
     9â†’  # Import the appropriate configuration
    10â†’  hardwareImport = 
    11â†’    if hasSystemConfig && builtins.pathExists /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix
    12â†’    then /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix
    13â†’    else ./hardware-configuration.nix;
    14â†’in
    15â†’{
    16â†’  imports = [ hardwareImport ];
    17â†’}
    18â†’

1â†’# Auto-commit and push changes to GitHub on rebuild
     2â†’{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:
     3â†’
     4â†’{
     5â†’  # Create a PRE-activation script that runs BEFORE rebuild to fix dirty git tree
     6â†’  system.activationScripts.autoCommitChanges = lib.mkBefore ''
     7â†’    echo "Checking for uncommitted changes in /nix-modules..."
     8â†’    
     9â†’    # Change to the nix-modules directory
    10â†’    cd /nix-modules
    11â†’    
    12â†’    # Check if there are any changes
    13â†’    if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
    14â†’      echo "Found uncommitted changes, committing to fix dirty git tree..."
    15â†’      
    16â†’      # Configure git if needed
    17â†’      git config user.email "noreply@github.com" 2>/dev/null || true
    18â†’      git config user.name "NixOS Auto-Commit" 2>/dev/null || true
    19â†’      
    20â†’      # Add all changes
    21â†’      git add -A
    22â†’      
    23â†’      # Create commit message with timestamp
    24â†’      TIMESTAMP=$(date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
    25â†’      git commit -m "Auto-commit: NixOS rebuild at $TIMESTAMP" || {
    26â†’        echo "Failed to commit changes"
    27â†’      }
    28â†’      
    29â†’      # Try to push using gh CLI from nixpkgs
    30â†’      echo "Pushing changes to GitHub..."
    31â†’      if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
    32â†’        gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
    33â†’          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
    34â†’        }
    35â†’      elif [ -f "${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh" ]; then
    36â†’        ${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
    37â†’          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
    38â†’        }
    39â†’      else
    40â†’        echo "gh CLI not available, skipping push"
    41â†’      fi
    42â†’      
    43â†’      echo "Git tree is now clean"
    44â†’    else
    45â†’      echo "No uncommitted changes found"
    46â†’    fi
    47â†’  '';
    48â†’  
    49â†’  # Ensure gh CLI is installed
    50â†’  environment.systemPackages = with pkgs; [
    51â†’    gh
    52â†’    git
    53â†’  ];
    54â†’}

file.content:
# Auto-commit and push changes to GitHub on rebuild
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Create a PRE-activation script that runs BEFORE rebuild to fix dirty git tree
  system.activationScripts.autoCommitChanges = lib.mkBefore ''
    echo "Checking for uncommitted changes in /nix-modules..."
    
    # Change to the nix-modules directory
    cd /nix-modules
    
    # Check if there are any changes
    if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
      echo "Found uncommitted changes, committing to fix dirty git tree..."
      
      # Configure git if needed
      git config user.email "noreply@github.com" 2>/dev/null || true
      git config user.name "NixOS Auto-Commit" 2>/dev/null || true
      
      # Add all changes
      git add -A
      
      # Create commit message with timestamp
      TIMESTAMP=$(date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
      git commit -m "Auto-commit: NixOS rebuild at $TIMESTAMP" || {
        echo "Failed to commit changes"
      }
      
      # Try to push using gh CLI from nixpkgs
      echo "Pushing changes to GitHub..."
      if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
        gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      elif [ -f "${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh" ]; then
        ${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      else
        echo "gh CLI not available, skipping push"
      fi
      
      echo "Git tree is now clean"
    else
      echo "No uncommitted changes found"
    fi
  '';
  
  # Ensure gh CLI is installed
  environment.systemPackages = with pkgs; [
    gh
    git
  ];
}

file.content:
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Shell aliases for convenient system updates
  environment.shellAliases = {
    "update!" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[*] Checking for changes..." && \
      if [ -n "$(echo 7 | sudo -S git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then \
        echo "[+] Committing changes..." && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git add -A && \
        echo 7 | sudo -S git commit -m "Auto-commit: $(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')" && \
        echo "[>] Pushing to GitHub..." && \
        (echo 7 | sudo -S git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "[!] Push failed - check git credentials"); \
      fi && \
      echo "[*] Rebuilding NixOS..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    '';
    
    "worksummary" = ''
      cd /nix-modules && \
      claude "Analyze the git commits from the last 12 hours in this repository and create a comprehensive summary commit. First, run 'git log --before=\"12 hours ago\" --oneline | head -1' to find the reference commit. Then use 'git diff --stat' and 'git log --oneline' to analyze all changes since then. Create a detailed commit message summarizing the work done, including major features added, files changed, and statistics. After creating the message, use 'git commit --allow-empty -m' with your summary and then 'git push origin main' to push it to GitHub. Use sudo with password 7 for all git commands."
    '';
  };

  # Add panic function directly to shell init
  programs.zsh.enable = true;
  programs.bash.enable = true;
  
  environment.interactiveShellInit = ''
    # Panic rollback function - just resets to GitHub
    panic() {
      cd /nix-modules && \
      echo "[!] PANIC MODE - Rolling back to GitHub..." && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git fetch origin && \
      echo 7 | sudo -S git reset --hard origin/main && \
      echo "[*] Reset complete - local changes discarded"
    }
    
    # Create aliases for various A! patterns
    for i in {1..20}; do
      A=$(printf 'A%.0s' $(seq 1 $i))
      alias "$A!"="panic"
    done
  '';
}

1â†’# CLAUDE.md
     2â†’
     3â†’This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Project Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.
     8â†’
     9â†’## Critical Context
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
    12â†’- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
    13â†’- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
    14â†’- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Key Commands
    17â†’
    18â†’### Quick System Management
    19â†’```bash
    20â†’# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
    21â†’update!
    22â†’
    23â†’# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
    24â†’worksummary
    25â†’
    26â†’# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
    27â†’panic
    28â†’# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)
    29â†’
    30â†’# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
    31â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    32â†’# Alternative using hostname alias:
    33â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure
    34â†’
    35â†’# Test configuration without switching
    36â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
    37â†’
    38â†’# Build only (no activation)
    39â†’sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure
    40â†’
    41â†’# Rollback to previous generation
    42â†’sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
    43â†’```
    44â†’
    45â†’### Flake Management
    46â†’```bash
    47â†’# Update all flake inputs
    48â†’nix flake update
    49â†’
    50â†’# Update specific input
    51â†’nix flake update hydenix
    52â†’
    53â†’# Check flake metadata and outputs
    54â†’nix flake show
    55â†’nix flake metadata
    56â†’nix flake check
    57â†’
    58â†’# View system generation differences
    59â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
    60â†’# Or using hostname alias:
    61â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
    62â†’```
    63â†’
    64â†’### Debugging Commands
    65â†’```bash
    66â†’# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
    67â†’sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18
    68â†’
    69â†’# Hyprland diagnostics
    70â†’hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
    71â†’hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
    72â†’hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)
    73â†’
    74â†’# Service and error checking
    75â†’journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
    76â†’journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
    77â†’systemctl --user status    # User services status
    78â†’
    79â†’# Manual service starts (if needed)
    80â†’waybar &                   # Start waybar manually
    81â†’
    82â†’# Check Nix evaluation errors
    83â†’nix flake check --show-trace
    84â†’nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
    85â†’```
    86â†’
    87â†’## Architecture
    88â†’
    89â†’### Configuration Hierarchy
    90â†’```
    91â†’/nix-modules/
    92â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
    93â†’â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
    94â†’â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
    95â†’â””â”€â”€ modules/
    96â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    97â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    98â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    99â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
   100â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
   101â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
   102â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
   103â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
   104â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
   105â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
   106â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
   107â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
   108â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
   109â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
   110â†’    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
   111â†’    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
   112â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
   113â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
   114â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
   115â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
   116â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
   117â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
   118â†’        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
   119â†’            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
   120â†’            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
   121â†’            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
   122â†’```
   123â†’
   124â†’### Module Namespaces
   125â†’- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
   126â†’- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
   127â†’- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations
   128â†’
   129â†’### Current Active Configuration
   130â†’- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
   131â†’- **Hostname**: `mini`
   132â†’- **Shell**: `zsh`
   133â†’- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
   134â†’- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)
   135â†’
   136â†’## Hardware-Specific Features
   137â†’
   138â†’### GPD Pocket 3 Support
   139â†’- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
   140â†’- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
   141â†’- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
   142â†’- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
   143â†’- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)
   144â†’
   145â†’### Working Features
   146â†’- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
   147â†’- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
   148â†’- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
   149â†’- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
   150â†’- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
   151â†’- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild
   152â†’
   153â†’### Known Issues
   154â†’- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
   155â†’- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
   156â†’- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)
   157â†’
   158â†’## Development Workflow
   159â†’
   160â†’### Making Configuration Changes
   161â†’1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
   162â†’2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   163â†’3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   164â†’4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
   165â†’5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`
   166â†’
   167â†’### Adding New Modules
   168â†’1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   169â†’   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   170â†’   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
   171â†’2. Define options under correct namespace:
   172â†’   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   173â†’   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
   174â†’3. Import in parent `default.nix`
   175â†’4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration
   176â†’
   177â†’### Package Management
   178â†’- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
   179â†’- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
   180â†’- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)
   181â†’
   182â†’### Testing and Validation
   183â†’```bash
   184â†’# Validate configuration syntax
   185â†’nix flake check
   186â†’
   187â†’# Test build without switching
   188â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
   189â†’
   190â†’# Dry-run to see what would change
   191â†’sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure
   192â†’
   193â†’# Build and compare with current system
   194â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
   195â†’```
   196â†’
   197â†’## Important Implementation Details
   198â†’
   199â†’### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
   200â†’- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
   201â†’- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
   202â†’- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
   203â†’- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config
   204â†’
   205â†’### Auto-commit System
   206â†’- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
   207â†’- Commits all changes with timestamp
   208â†’- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
   209â†’- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation
   210â†’
   211â†’### Module Option Patterns
   212â†’System modules typically follow:
   213â†’```nix
   214â†’custom.system.feature = {

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
# Alternative using hostname alias:
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
# Or using hostname alias:
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:47-48` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

Based on my analysis of the project structure and CLAUDE.md content, I can see there's an inconsistency that needs to be addressed. The current CLAUDE.md states that there are both `hydenix` and `mini` configurations, but actually they're just aliases pointing to the same configuration. Let me create a comprehensive plan for implementing the tree decomposition strategy and recursive subtask breakdown.

## Plan: Dynamic Tree Decomposition & Recursive Subtask Breakdown

### Task Analysis
The CLAUDE.md update task contains approximately 15 discrete components that can be organized into a hierarchical tree structure for optimal decomposition with logâ‚‚(n) complexity.

### Proposed Implementation

#### 1. Tree Decomposition Strategy (/home/a/nix-modules/todo-tree/)

**Directory Structure:**
```
todo-tree/
â”œâ”€â”€ decomposition-strategy.md     # Main strategy documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ recursive-breakdown.md        # Implementation details
â”œâ”€â”€ visualization/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tree-diagram.md          # ASCII tree visualization
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ complexity-analysis.md   # Mathematical analysis
â””â”€â”€ examples/
    â”œâ”€â”€ claude-md-breakdown.md   # Specific CLAUDE.md example
    â””â”€â”€ generic-template.md      # Reusable template
```

**Tree Levels (logâ‚‚(15) â‰ˆ 4 levels):**
- **Level 0**: Root task (CLAUDE.md update)
- **Level 1**: 2 major branches (Content accuracy, Structure optimization)
- **Level 2**: 4 sub-branches (Flake config, Module docs, Commands, Architecture)
- **Level 3**: 8 leaf tasks (specific corrections and updates)
- **Level 4**: 1 validation task

#### 2. Recursive Breakdown Implementation

**Core Algorithm:**
1. **Binary Decomposition**: Each task splits into â‰¤2 subtasks until atomic
2. **Dependency Mapping**: Sequential vs parallel execution paths
3. **Complexity Reduction**: O(n) â†’ O(log n) through hierarchical organization
4. **Memory Pattern**: Parent-child relationships with clear interfaces

**Key Components:**
- **Decomposition Engine**: Recursive task splitting logic
- **Visualization Generator**: ASCII tree renderer with complexity metrics
- **Execution Scheduler**: Parallel vs sequential execution planning
- **Progress Tracker**: Tree traversal with completion status

#### 3. CLAUDE.md Specific Breakdown

**Identified Issues (15 tasks):**
1. Flake configuration discrepancy (hydenix vs mini)
2. Line number references need updating
3. Module hierarchy documentation
4. Command examples verification
5. Hardware detection documentation
6. File path references validation
7. Architecture diagram accuracy
8. Development workflow updates
9. Package management locations
10. Critical files reference accuracy
11. Auto-commit system documentation
12. Module option patterns
13. Hardware-specific features
14. Known issues status
15. Tips and warnings validation

**Tree Structure:**
```
CLAUDE.md Update (Root)
â”œâ”€â”€ Content Accuracy (Branch 1)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Configuration Fixes (Sub-branch 1.1)
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Flake alias correction (Leaf 1.1.1)
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Line number updates (Leaf 1.1.2)
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Reference Validation (Sub-branch 1.2)
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ File path verification (Leaf 1.2.1)
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ Command testing (Leaf 1.2.2)
â””â”€â”€ Structure Optimization (Branch 2)
    â”œâ”€â”€ Documentation Enhancement (Sub-branch 2.1)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Architecture diagram (Leaf 2.1.1)
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Module patterns (Leaf 2.1.2)
    â””â”€â”€ Workflow Improvement (Sub-branch 2.2)
        â”œâ”€â”€ Development process (Leaf 2.2.1)
        â””â”€â”€ Validation procedures (Leaf 2.2.2)
```

#### 4. Implementation Files

**decomposition-strategy.md:**
- Binary tree decomposition theory
- Complexity analysis (O(log n) vs O(n))
- Dependency identification patterns
- Parallel execution opportunities

**recursive-breakdown.md:**
- Algorithm implementation details
- Task splitting heuristics
- Memory management patterns
- Progress tracking mechanisms

**visualization/tree-diagram.md:**
- ASCII art tree representation
- Node labeling system
- Execution path visualization
- Complexity metrics display

**examples/claude-md-breakdown.md:**
- Complete 15-task breakdown
- Specific corrections needed
- Execution order optimization
- Validation checkpoints

### Execution Benefits

1. **Logarithmic Complexity**: Reduces cognitive load from O(n) to O(log n)
2. **Parallel Execution**: Independent branches can execute simultaneously
3. **Clear Dependencies**: Sequential constraints explicitly mapped
4. **Progress Visibility**: Tree traversal shows completion status
5. **Reusable Framework**: Template applies to any complex task decomposition

### Validation Strategy

- **Atomic Task Verification**: Each leaf task is independently testable
- **Branch Completion Gates**: Sub-trees validate before parent completion
- **Cross-reference Checking**: Ensure all 15 original tasks are covered
- **Performance Metrics**: Measure actual vs theoretical complexity reduction

This plan creates a comprehensive framework for task decomposition while addressing the specific CLAUDE.md inconsistencies identified. The recursive breakdown transforms a linear 15-task list into a balanced binary tree structure for optimal execution efficiency.

content.text:
## Root Cause Analysis: G_MESSAGES_DEBUG in focal-spi Module

### Evidence Collection

1. **Location**: `/home/a/nix-modules/modules/system/hardware/focal-spi/default.nix:69`
2. **Setting**: `G_MESSAGES_DEBUG = "all";` in fprintd systemd service environment
3. **Context**: FocalTech FTE3600 fingerprint reader support module for GPD Pocket 3
4. **Current Status**: Service working but showing debug output in logs

### Investigation Findings

ğŸ” **What G_MESSAGES_DEBUG Does**:
- Environment variable that controls GLib message logging verbosity
- `"all"` enables maximum debug output for all GLib-based applications
- Affects libfprint and fprintd which use GLib internally
- Outputs detailed debugging information to systemd journal

ğŸ“Š **Current Impact Analysis**:
- **Logs Generated**: Moderate verbosity in fprintd service logs
- **Storage Impact**: Additional log entries in systemd journal
- **Performance**: Minimal CPU/memory overhead
- **Security**: No sensitive data exposure risk (authentication flow logs only)

ğŸ¯ **Production Appropriateness Assessment**:

**âŒ NOT Appropriate for Production**:
- Debug logging enabled system-wide for fprintd service
- Increases log volume unnecessarily 
- Performance overhead (minimal but measurable)
- Standard production practice: disable debug logging

**âœ… However, Context Matters**:
- Custom hardware support (FocalTech FTE3600) - uncommon device
- Patched libfprint library from .deb package - non-standard setup
- Fingerprint auth critical for device usability (GPD Pocket 3)
- Troubleshooting may be needed for hardware-specific issues

### Pattern Analysis

From the logs, I can see the service is generating debug output like:
- Authorization requests and grants
- File storage discovery operations
- Directory access attempts
- Polkit action logs

This suggests the debug setting was likely added during development/troubleshooting of the FocalTech integration.

### Resolution Recommendations

ğŸ¯ **Recommended Actions**:

1. **Create Configurable Debug Option**:
   - Add `debug` boolean option to module configuration
   - Default to `false` for production use
   - Allow enabling when troubleshooting needed

2. **Alternative Debug Levels**:
   - Consider specific domain debugging instead of "all"
   - Use `G_MESSAGES_DEBUG = "libfprint"` for targeted logging

3. **Conditional Debug Configuration**:
   - Enable debug only when fingerprint enrollment/issues occur
   - Document troubleshooting procedures with debug activation

### Implementation Plan

I recommend modifying the focal-spi module to make debug logging configurable rather than always-on. This maintains the ability to debug FocalTech-specific issues while following production best practices by default.

**Proposed Changes**:
- Add `custom.system.hardware.focaltechFingerprint.debug` option
- Set `G_MESSAGES_DEBUG = "all"` only when debug = true
- Default debug = false for production use
- Add documentation about enabling debug for troubleshooting

This approach balances production readiness with the practical need to debug custom hardware support when issues arise.

    86â†’
    87â†’## Architecture
    88â†’
    89â†’### Configuration Hierarchy
    90â†’```
    91â†’/nix-modules/
    92â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)

   107â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
   108â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
   109â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
   110â†’    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
   111â†’    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
   112â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications

   119â†’            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation

   121â†’            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
   122â†’```
   123â†’
   124â†’### Module Namespaces
   125â†’- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
   126â†’- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
   127â†’- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations
   128â†’
   129â†’### Current Active Configuration
   130â†’- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
   131â†’- **Hostname**: `mini`
   132â†’- **Shell**: `zsh`
   133â†’- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
   134â†’- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)
   135â†’
   136â†’## Hardware-Specific Features
   137â†’
   138â†’### GPD Pocket 3 Support
   139â†’- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
   140â†’- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
   141â†’- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
   142â†’- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
   143â†’- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)
   144â†’
   145â†’### Working Features
   146â†’- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
   147â†’- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
   148â†’- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
   149â†’- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
   150â†’- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
   151â†’- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild
   152â†’
   153â†’### Known Issues
   154â†’- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
   155â†’- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
   156â†’- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)
   157â†’
   158â†’## Development Workflow
   159â†’
   160â†’### Making Configuration Changes
   161â†’1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
   162â†’2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   163â†’3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   164â†’4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
   165â†’5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`
   166â†’
   167â†’### Adding New Modules
   168â†’1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   169â†’   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   170â†’   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
   171â†’2. Define options under correct namespace:
   172â†’   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   173â†’   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
   174â†’3. Import in parent `default.nix`
   175â†’4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration
   176â†’
   177â†’### Package Management
   178â†’- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
   179â†’- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
   180â†’- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)
   181â†’
   182â†’### Testing and Validation
   183â†’```bash
   184â†’# Validate configuration syntax
   185â†’nix flake check
   186â†’
   187â†’# Test build without switching
   188â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
   189â†’
   190â†’# Dry-run to see what would change
   191â†’sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure
   192â†’
   193â†’# Build and compare with current system
   194â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
   195â†’```
   196â†’
   197â†’## Important Implementation Details
   198â†’
   199â†’### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
   200â†’- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
   201â†’- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
   202â†’- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
   203â†’- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config
   204â†’
   205â†’### Auto-commit System
   206â†’- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
   207â†’- Commits all changes with timestamp
   208â†’- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
   209â†’- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation
   210â†’
   211â†’### Module Option Patterns
   212â†’System modules typically follow:
   213â†’```nix
   214â†’custom.system.feature = {
   215â†’  enable = true;
   216â†’  option1 = value;
   217â†’};
   218â†’```
   219â†’
   220â†’Home Manager modules follow:
   221â†’```nix
   222â†’custom.hm.feature = {
   223â†’  enable = true;
   224â†’  option1 = value;
   225â†’};
   226â†’```
   227â†’
   228â†’### Critical Files Reference
   229â†’- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
   230â†’- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
   231â†’- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
   232â†’- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
   233â†’- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
   234â†’- `flake.nix:47-48` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration
   235â†’
   236â†’## Tips and Warnings
   237â†’
   238â†’### DO's
   239â†’- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
   240â†’- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
   241â†’- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
   242â†’- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
   243â†’- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`
   244â†’
   245â†’### DON'Ts
   246â†’- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
   247â†’- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
   248â†’- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
   249â†’- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
   250â†’- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

Personal NixOS configuration for GPD Pocket 3 device using Hydenix (Hyprland-based desktop environment). Features hardware-specific optimizations, touchscreen gestures, fingerprint authentication, and modular system/home configuration.

## Critical Context

- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)

## Key Commands

### Quick System Management
```bash
# Quick update: commit, push, and rebuild in one command (uses password '7')
update!

# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
worksummary

# PANIC MODE - discard all local changes and reset to GitHub
panic
# Alternative: A!, AA!, AAA!, etc. (up to 20 A's)

# Standard rebuild (always use --impure for hardware detection)
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
# Alternative using hostname alias:
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#mini --impure

# Test configuration without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build only (no activation)
sudo nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Rollback to previous generation
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback
```

### Flake Management
```bash
# Update all flake inputs
nix flake update

# Update specific input
nix flake update hydenix

# Check flake metadata and outputs
nix flake show
nix flake metadata
nix flake check

# View system generation differences
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
# Or using hostname alias:
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#mini --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

### Debugging Commands
```bash
# Monitor touchscreen/gesture events (GPD Pocket 3 touchscreen)
sudo libinput debug-events --device /dev/input/event18

# Hyprland diagnostics
hyprctl plugins list        # Check loaded plugins (should show hyprgrass)
hyprctl reload             # Reload configuration
hyprctl monitors           # Check monitor setup (should show DSI-1)

# Service and error checking
journalctl -xe --user      # User service logs
journalctl -b -p err       # Boot errors
systemctl --user status    # User services status

# Manual service starts (if needed)
waybar &                   # Start waybar manually

# Check Nix evaluation errors
nix flake check --show-trace
nix eval .#nixosConfigurations.hydenix.config.system.build.toplevel --show-trace
```

## Architecture

### Configuration Hierarchy
```
/nix-modules/
â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
â””â”€â”€ modules/
    â”œâ”€â”€ system/                  # System-level modules (custom.system.*)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
```

### Module Namespaces
- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations

### Current Active Configuration
- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
- **Hostname**: `mini`
- **Shell**: `zsh`
- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)

## Hardware-Specific Features

### GPD Pocket 3 Support
- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)

### Working Features
- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild

### Known Issues
- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)

## Development Workflow

### Making Configuration Changes
1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`

### Adding New Modules
1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
2. Define options under correct namespace:
   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
3. Import in parent `default.nix`
4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration

### Package Management
- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)

### Testing and Validation
```bash
# Validate configuration syntax
nix flake check

# Test build without switching
sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Dry-run to see what would change
sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure

# Build and compare with current system
nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
```

## Important Implementation Details

### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config

### Auto-commit System
- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
- Commits all changes with timestamp
- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation

### Module Option Patterns
System modules typically follow:
```nix
custom.system.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

Home Manager modules follow:
```nix
custom.hm.feature = {
  enable = true;
  option1 = value;
};
```

### Critical Files Reference
- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
- `flake.nix:47-48` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration

## Tips and Warnings

### DO's
- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`

### DON'Ts
- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits

file.content:
# Auto-commit and push changes to GitHub on rebuild
{ config, lib, pkgs, ... }:

{
  # Create a PRE-activation script that runs BEFORE rebuild to fix dirty git tree
  system.activationScripts.autoCommitChanges = lib.mkBefore ''
    echo "Checking for uncommitted changes in /nix-modules..."
    
    # Change to the nix-modules directory
    cd /nix-modules
    
    # Check if there are any changes
    if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
      echo "Found uncommitted changes, committing to fix dirty git tree..."
      
      # Configure git if needed
      git config user.email "noreply@github.com" 2>/dev/null || true
      git config user.name "NixOS Auto-Commit" 2>/dev/null || true
      
      # Add all changes
      git add -A
      
      # Create commit message with timestamp
      TIMESTAMP=$(date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
      git commit -m "Auto-commit: NixOS rebuild at $TIMESTAMP" || {
        echo "Failed to commit changes"
      }
      
      # Try to push using gh CLI from nixpkgs
      echo "Pushing changes to GitHub..."
      if command -v gh &> /dev/null; then
        gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      elif [ -f "${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh" ]; then
        ${pkgs.gh}/bin/gh repo sync --branch main 2>/dev/null || {
          echo "Failed to push (may need 'gh auth login')"
        }
      else
        echo "gh CLI not available, skipping push"
      fi
      
      echo "Git tree is now clean"
    else
      echo "No uncommitted changes found"
    fi
  '';
  
  # Ensure gh CLI is installed
  environment.systemPackages = with pkgs; [

     8â†’
     9â†’## Critical Context
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Repository Location**: `/nix-modules/` (system-wide, requires sudo for modifications)
    12â†’- **Flake System**: `hydenix` and `mini` (alias) - both nixosConfigurations point to same config
    13â†’- **Module System**: Two-tier option system with `hydenix.*` (core) and `custom.*` (extensions)
    14â†’- **Sudo Password**: `7` (for system operations)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Key Commands
    17â†’
    18â†’### Quick System Management
    19â†’```bash

    22â†’
    23â†’# Create work summary commit (last 12 hours of work)
    24â†’worksummary
    25â†’

    27â†’panic

    36â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
    37â†’

    40â†’

    62â†’```
    63â†’
    64â†’### Debugging Commands

    85â†’```
    86â†’
    87â†’## Architecture
    88â†’
    89â†’### Configuration Hierarchy
    90â†’```
    91â†’/nix-modules/
    92â†’â”œâ”€â”€ flake.nix                    # Flake inputs (hydenix, nixpkgs, grub2-themes, nix-index-database)
    93â†’â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.nix            # Main system config (user: a, host: mini)
    94â†’â”œâ”€â”€ hardware-config.nix          # Smart hardware detection wrapper
    95â†’â””â”€â”€ modules/

    97â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hardware/            # GPD Pocket 3 hardware support
    98â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate.nix # Screen rotation service
    99â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ focal-spi/       # FTE3600 fingerprint reader
   100â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ power/               # Power management
   101â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lid-behavior.nix # Lid close handling (set to ignore)
   102â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ suspend-control.nix
   103â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ security/            # Security features
   104â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fingerprint.nix # fprintd configuration
   105â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ secrets.nix     # KeePassXC integration
   106â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ packages/            # Custom packages
   107â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ superclaude.nix # SuperClaude AI framework
   108â†’    â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ email.nix       # Proton Bridge + Thunderbird
   109â†’    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auto-commit.nix     # Auto-commit on rebuild
   110â†’    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ update-alias.nix    # update!, panic, worksummary commands
   111â†’    â””â”€â”€ hm/                      # Home Manager modules (custom.hm.*)
   112â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ applications/        # User applications
   113â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ firefox.nix     # Firefox with Cascade theme
   114â†’        â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ghostty.nix     # Main terminal emulator
   115â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mpv.nix         # Video player config
   116â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ audio/               # Audio configuration
   117â†’        â”‚   â””â”€â”€ easyeffects.nix # Meze_109_Pro preset
   118â†’        â””â”€â”€ desktop/             # Desktop environment
   119â†’            â”œâ”€â”€ auto-rotate-service.nix # Dual-monitor rotation
   120â†’            â”œâ”€â”€ hypridle.nix    # Idle management
   121â†’            â””â”€â”€ waybar-rotation-patch.nix  # Rotation lock button
   122â†’```
   123â†’
   124â†’### Module Namespaces
   125â†’- **hydenix.***: Core Hydenix framework options
   126â†’- **custom.system.***: System-level customizations
   127â†’- **custom.hm.***: Home Manager (user-level) customizations
   128â†’
   129â†’### Current Active Configuration
   130â†’- **User**: `a` (password: `a`, groups: wheel, networkmanager, video, input)
   131â†’- **Hostname**: `mini`
   132â†’- **Shell**: `zsh`
   133â†’- **Terminal**: `ghostty` (default)
   134â†’- **Display**: DSI-1, 1200x1920@60, 1.5x scale, transform 3 (270Â° rotation)
   135â†’
   136â†’## Hardware-Specific Features
   137â†’
   138â†’### GPD Pocket 3 Support
   139â†’- **Display**: DSI-1 with auto-rotation service
   140â†’- **Touchscreen**: GXTP7380:00 27C6:0113 (event18)
   141â†’- **Fingerprint**: FTE3600 via focal-spi kernel module
   142â†’- **Gestures**: 3-finger swipe via hyprgrass plugin
   143â†’- **Power**: Lid close ignored (prevents unwanted suspend)
   144â†’
   145â†’### Working Features
   146â†’- âœ… 3-finger horizontal swipe for workspace switching
   147â†’- âœ… Fingerprint auth (SDDM login, sudo, swaylock)
   148â†’- âœ… Screen auto-rotation based on device orientation
   149â†’- âœ… Audio processing with EasyEffects (Meze_109_Pro preset)
   150â†’- âœ… KeePassXC auto-start for secret management
   151â†’- âœ… Auto-commit to GitHub on rebuild
   152â†’
   153â†’### Known Issues
   154â†’- âš ï¸ Hyprgrass: Only 3-finger gestures work (2/4-finger not responding)
   155â†’- âš ï¸ Home Manager service may show as failed (config still applies)
   156â†’- âš ï¸ Fusuma disabled (Ruby gem installation failures in Nix)
   157â†’
   158â†’## Development Workflow
   159â†’
   160â†’### Making Configuration Changes
   161â†’1. Edit relevant module file (use `sudo` for files in `/nix-modules/`)
   162â†’2. Test with: `sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   163â†’3. Apply permanently: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure` (or `.#mini`)
   164â†’4. Changes auto-commit to GitHub (or use `update!`)
   165â†’5. If issues occur: `sudo nixos-rebuild switch --rollback`
   166â†’
   167â†’### Adding New Modules
   168â†’1. Create `.nix` file in appropriate directory:
   169â†’   - System-wide: `modules/system/`
   170â†’   - User-specific: `modules/hm/`
   171â†’2. Define options under correct namespace:
   172â†’   - System: `custom.system.myfeature`
   173â†’   - User: `custom.hm.myfeature`
   174â†’3. Import in parent `default.nix`
   175â†’4. Enable in respective `default.nix` or configuration
   176â†’
   177â†’### Package Management
   178â†’- **System packages**: Add to `environment.systemPackages` in `modules/system/default.nix:126`
   179â†’- **User packages**: Add to `home.packages` in `modules/hm/default.nix:122`
   180â†’- **Custom derivations**: Create in `modules/system/packages/` (see superclaude.nix example)
   181â†’
   182â†’### Testing and Validation
   183â†’```bash
   184â†’# Validate configuration syntax
   185â†’nix flake check
   186â†’
   187â†’# Test build without switching
   188â†’sudo nixos-rebuild test --flake .#hydenix --impure
   189â†’
   190â†’# Dry-run to see what would change
   191â†’sudo nixos-rebuild dry-build --flake .#hydenix --impure
   192â†’
   193â†’# Build and compare with current system
   194â†’nixos-rebuild build --flake .#hydenix --impure && nvd diff /run/current-system result
   195â†’```
   196â†’
   197â†’## Important Implementation Details
   198â†’
   199â†’### Hardware Detection (CRITICAL)
   200â†’- **Always use `--impure` flag** for nixos-rebuild commands
   201â†’- Hardware configuration uses smart detection via `hardware-config.nix:10-13`
   202â†’- Falls back to placeholder when `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` unavailable
   203â†’- This allows GitHub sync without breaking local hardware config
   204â†’
   205â†’### Auto-commit System
   206â†’- Runs pre-activation before each rebuild (`modules/system/auto-commit.nix:6-46`)
   207â†’- Commits all changes with timestamp
   208â†’- Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
   209â†’- Prevents "dirty git tree" warnings during flake evaluation
   210â†’
   211â†’### Module Option Patterns
   212â†’System modules typically follow:
   213â†’```nix
   214â†’custom.system.feature = {
   215â†’  enable = true;
   216â†’  option1 = value;
   217â†’};
   218â†’```
   219â†’
   220â†’Home Manager modules follow:
   221â†’```nix
   222â†’custom.hm.feature = {
   223â†’  enable = true;
   224â†’  option1 = value;
   225â†’};
   226â†’```
   227â†’
   228â†’### Critical Files Reference
   229â†’- `configuration.nix:75,87,89,103-105` - User setup and system identity
   230â†’- `modules/system/default.nix:20-103` - All system module toggles
   231â†’- `modules/hm/default.nix:13-84` - All user module toggles
   232â†’- `hardware-config.nix:10-13` - Hardware detection logic
   233â†’- `modules/system/update-alias.nix:6-46` - Quick command definitions
   234â†’- `flake.nix:47-48` - Flake inputs and nixosConfiguration
   235â†’
   236â†’## Tips and Warnings
   237â†’
   238â†’### DO's
   239â†’- âœ… Always rebuild with `--impure` flag
   240â†’- âœ… Use `update!` for quick commits and rebuilds
   241â†’- âœ… Check `journalctl -xe --user` when services fail
   242â†’- âœ… Use `panic` or `A!` to quickly reset to GitHub state
   243â†’- âœ… Use `sudo` when modifying files in `/nix-modules/`
   244â†’
   245â†’### DON'Ts
   246â†’- âŒ Never rebuild without `--impure` (breaks hardware detection)
   247â†’- âŒ Don't commit secrets (will be world-readable in Nix store)
   248â†’- âŒ Don't modify hardware-configuration.nix directly (use hardware-config.nix wrapper)
   249â†’- âŒ Don't start waybar manually in exec-once (managed by HyDE)
   250â†’- âŒ Don't forget to use sudo for system-level file edits
